title: Biosample

fly_synchronization_stage.comment: Only fly biosamples are allowed to have fly_synchronization_stage property.

worm_life_stage.comment: Only roundworm biosamples are allowed to have worm_life_stage property.

starting_amount_units.comment: Biosamples with a specified starting_amount_units require starting_amount to also be specified.

organism.comment: Human biosamples are not allowed to have model organism properties, and biosample_ontology classification should be different from whole organisms.

post_differentiation_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_differentiation_time requires post_differentiation_time_units specification.

model_organism_age_units.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_age_units requires model_organism_age specification.

post_synchronization_time.comment: Human and mouse biosamples are not allowed to have post_synchronization_time property. Biosample with a specified post_synchronization_time requires post_synchronization_time_units specification and model organism synchronization stage.

starting_amount.comment: Biosamples with a specified starting_amount require starting_amount_units to also be specified.

PMI.comment: Tissue biosamples with a specified PMI require PMI_units to also be specified.

worm_synchronization_stage.comment: Only roundworm biosamples are allowed to have worm_synchronization_stage property.

post_treatment_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_treatment_time_units requires non-empty treatments list post_treatment_time specification.

post_treatment_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_treatment_time requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time_units specification.

post_synchronization_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_synchronization_units requires post_synchronization_time specification and specification of the model organism synchronization stage.

mouse_life_stage.comment: Only mouse biosamples are allowed to have mouse_life_stage property.

pooled_from.comment: Biosample with a specified pooled_from list requires at least two entries in the list.

PMI_units.comment: Tissue biosamples with a specified PMI_units require PMI to also be specified.

model_organism_mating_status.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_mating_status requires model_organism_sex specification.

fly_life_stage.comment: Only fly biosamples are allowed to have fly_life_stage property.

post_differentiation_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_differentiation_time_units requires post_differentiation_time specification.

model_organism_age.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_age requires model_organism_age_units specification.

comment: For cultured samples this object represents unique growths or culture harvests.

___mouse_life_stage.description: The life stage of the mouse biosample.
___mouse_life_stage.comment: mouse_life_stage is not valid for a human biosample.
___mouse_life_stage.title: Mouse life stage

___internal_tags.description: Some biosamples are part of particular data collections.
___internal_tags.comment: Do not submit. Internal tags are for DCC use only.
___internal_tags.title: Internal tags

___pooled_from.description: The biosamples from which aliquots were pooled to form the biosample.
___pooled_from.comment: A list of biosamples used to create the biosample, if specified, it requires minimum of two entries.
___pooled_from.title: Pooled from

items.description: A biosample from which an aliquot was taken to form the biosample.

___culture_harvest_date.description: For cultured samples, the date the biosample was taken.
___culture_harvest_date.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD. The property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].
___culture_harvest_date.title: Culture harvest date

___model_organism_mating_status.description: The mating status of the animal.
___model_organism_mating_status.comment: The value is not available for human biosamples.
___model_organism_mating_status.title: Model organism mating status

___starting_amount_units.description: The units used to quantify the amount of cells or tissue obtained.
___starting_amount_units.title: Starting amount units

___model_organism_health_status.description: Health status of the model organism.
___model_organism_health_status.comment: model_organism_health_status is not valid for a human biosample.
___model_organism_health_status.title: Model organism health status

___cell_isolation_method.description: The method by which the cell(s) in the sampe were isolated.
___cell_isolation_method.comment: Indicate the method used to isolate cell(s) in the sample. For example Fluidigm C1 cell isolation should specify: microfluidic cell sorting.
___cell_isolation_method.title: Cell isolation method

___PMI.description: The amount of time elapsed since death.
___PMI.comment: Post-mortem interval for tissues should be reported, if known. Using for biosamples other than tissue is currently not allowed.
___PMI.title: Post-mortem interval

___date_obtained.description: For tissue samples, the date the biosample was taken.
___date_obtained.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD.
___date_obtained.title: Date obtained

___documents.description: Documents that describe the biosample preparation.

___post_synchronization_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when animals were synchronized.
___post_synchronization_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with fly_synchronization_stage or worm_synchronization_stage and post_synchronization_time to specify time elapsed post-synchronization.
___post_synchronization_time_units.title: Post-synchronization time units

___originated_from.description: A biosample that the sample was orginated from.
___originated_from.title: Originated from

___subcellular_fraction_term_name.description: The GO (Gene Ontology) term name for cellular component that constitutes the biosample.
___subcellular_fraction_term_name.title: Subcellular fraction

___starting_amount.description: The initial quantity of cells, tissue or animals obtained.
___starting_amount.title: Starting amount

elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.description: Defines one of three types of indexing available
elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.title: Field mapping index type

___description.description: A plain text description of the biosample. Do not include experiment details, genetic modifications or treatments.
___description.comment: Free text description of the biosample, do not mix with biosample summary that is calculated and controlled.
___description.title: Description

___passage_number.description: Number of passages including the passages from the source.
___passage_number.comment: In calculating passage number, include passages from the source.
___passage_number.title: Passage number

___fly_life_stage.description: Fly development stage of the animals used to prepare the biosample.
___fly_life_stage.comment: fly_life_stage is valid only for fly biosamples.
___fly_life_stage.title: Fly life stage

___depleted_in_term_name.description: UBERON (Uber Anatomy Ontology) term best matching the tissue(s)/body part(s) that were removed from the biosample.
___depleted_in_term_name.title: Depleted in term

___donor.description: The donor or strain the biosample was originated from.
___donor.comment: For human biosamples, see human_donor.json for available identifiers. For mouse biosamples, see mouse_donor.json for available identifiers. For worm biosamples, see worm_donor.json for available identifiers. For fly biosamples, see fly_donor.json for available identifiers.
___donor.title: Donor

___post_treatment_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were treated.
___post_treatment_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_treatment_time and treatment to specify time elapsed post-treatment. post_treatment_time_units specification requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time specification.
___post_treatment_time_units.title: Post-treatment time units

___model_organism_age.description: The age or age range of the model donor organism when biological material was sampled.
___model_organism_age.comment: model_organism_age is not valid for a human biosample.
___model_organism_age.title: Age

___worm_life_stage.description: Worm development stage of the animals used to prepare the biosample.
___worm_life_stage.comment: worm_life_stage is valid only for worm biosamples.
___worm_life_stage.title: Worm life stage
enum: mixed stage (late embryonic and L1 larva)

___post_differentiation_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were differentiated.
___post_differentiation_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_differentiation_time to specify time elapsed post-differentiation. Use of this property requires post_differentiation_time specification.
___post_differentiation_time_units.title: Post-differentiation time units

___alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
___alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.
___alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions

items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.
items.title: Alternate Accession

___host.description: A biosample that was hosting this biosample.
___host.comment: For example a mouse could be a host of bone marrow biosample in case of transplantation. See biosamples.json for available identifiers.
___host.title: Host biosample

___nih_institutional_certification.description: Institutional certification given by the NIH for human biosamples.
___nih_institutional_certification.title: NIH institutional certification

___post_synchronization_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when animals were synchronized.
___post_synchronization_time.comment: Use in conjunction with fly_synchronization_stage or worm_synchronization_stage to specify time elapsed post-synchronization. It requires specification of post_synchronization_time_units as well.
___post_synchronization_time.title: Post-synchronization time

___treatments.description: A list of treatments applied to the biosample.
___treatments.comment: A list of treatments applied to the biosample, it is required to be non-empty if post_treatment_time or post_treatment_time_units are specified.
___treatments.title: Treatments

___post_differentiation_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were differentiated.
___post_differentiation_time.comment: Use in conjunction with post_differentiation_time_units to specify time elapsed post-differentiation. Use of this property requires post_differentiation_time_units specification.
___post_differentiation_time.title: Post-differentiation time

___organism.description: The organism the biosample was originated from.
___organism.title: Organism

___phase.description: Specification of cell cycle phase of the biosample.
___phase.comment: The phase property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].
___phase.title: Cell cycle phase

___dbxrefs.description: Biosample identifiers from external resources, such as Biosample database or Cellosaurus.
___dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit. DCC personnel is responsible for submission of biosample external resource identifiers.
___dbxrefs.title: External resources

___fly_synchronization_stage.description: Fly development stage at which flies were synchronized.
___fly_synchronization_stage.comment: Stage at which flies were synchronized. If available use in conjunction with time and time units post-synchronization.
___fly_synchronization_stage.title: Fly synchronization stage
enum: puff stage: PS (1-2), dark blue gut
puff stage: PS (3-6), light blue gut

___post_treatment_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were treated.
___post_treatment_time.comment: Use in conjunction with treatment and post_treatment_time_units to specify time elapsed post-treatment. post_treatment_time specification requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time_units specification.
___post_treatment_time.title: Post-treatment time

___PMI_units.description: The unit in which the PMI time was reported.
___PMI_units.comment: Post-mortem interval units for tissues should be reported with PMI value, if known. Using for biosamples other than tissue is currently not allowed.
___PMI_units.title: Post-mortem interval units

___preservation_method.description: The method by which the sample was preserved: cryopreservation (slow-freeze) or flash-freezing.
___preservation_method.comment: Indicate the sample preservation_method if known and may be/become an experimental variable to track.
___preservation_method.title: Preservation method

___model_organism_age_units.description: Age units of the model organism.
___model_organism_age_units.comment: model_organism_age_units are not valid for a human biosample.
___model_organism_age_units.title: Age units

___model_organism_sex.description: The sex of the model organism the biosample comes from.
___model_organism_sex.comment: model_organism_sex is not valid for a human biosample.
___model_organism_sex.title: Model organism sex

___culture_start_date.description: For cultured samples, the date the culture was started. For cell lines, the date this particular growth was started, not the date the line was established.
___culture_start_date.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD. The property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].
___culture_start_date.title: Culture start date

___part_of.description: A biosample from which a discrete component was taken. That component is this biosample.
___part_of.title: Separated from

___worm_synchronization_stage.description: Worm development stage at which the animals were synchronized.
___worm_synchronization_stage.comment: Stage at which worms were synchronized. Use in conjunction with time and time units post-synchronization.  worm_life_stage is valid only for worm biosamples.
___worm_synchronization_stage.title: Worm synchronization stage
